revised_title: Observations of Venus on the Disk of the Sun and the Search for a Satellite
tldr: The author, Samuel Dunn, observes the planet Venus on the disk of the Sun during its transit in 1761. He uses a Newtonian reflecting telescope and an eight-day clock to measure the time and position of Venus. Although he does not discover a satellite, he provides detailed observations of Venus's atmosphere and its internal contact with the Sun.
